content.description: Stand start with hands matched on a pair of edges. From there, reach a left hand edge, follow to a right hand edge, bring the feet along, make a big move to a right hand bump, reach a left hand edge below the lip, then move to the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will do. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Monument.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a low block-edge and spread feet. From there, bump through a right hand pinch to gain an edge, then reach a good left hand edge, follow to the lip, and finish up the remaining features (be careful what you pull on for the topout).
content.protection: I used two pads on this one. It seemed to work well despite the uneven rock that makes up the landing.
content.location: It climbs the center section of Monument's west face.

content.description: Sit start with a sloping left hand, a right hand conglomeration, and feet pasted. From there, pull up to a left hand sidepull, reach and match hands on a mini-rail, gain a right hand pocket, make a big move to jug, finish up the remainder on lichen-loaded features.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there is a tree behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Monument's west face.
